p: HSV-2 natural history was described by the stages of primary infection, latent infection, and reactivation [ 16]. Viral shedding was assumed to occur only during primary infection and reactivations at a frequency of 14% of the time [ 16, 25]. HSV-2 transmission probability per coital act during shedding was determined through several analyses [ 16]. Based on evidence of the pattern, sites, and frequency of subclinical reactivations [ 26], all seropositive persons were assumed equally infectious regardless of clinical symptoms.
